subject: HowStuffWorks Automotive Newsletter May 22, 2007

howstuffworks® | automotive May 22, 2007
RSS
  
 How Muscle Cars Work  Muscle cars thundered across the landscape in the 1960s and
early 1970s -- loud, proud and uniquely American. From the Pontiac GTO to the
Dodge Challenger, these fast, powerful cars created their own culture. Learn
all about the golden age of muscle cars and how they evolved into today's road
rockets.
Also at HowStuffWorks
 

Are we on the brink of the flying car?
 - A flying-car-style rescue vehicle called X-Hawk could be on
the market as early as 2012. If it's successful, it could be the
proof-of-concept that opens the doors to other flying cars still in the
development stage. Learn more.
 

How to Buy a Fuel-efficient Car
- Buying a car with fuel economy in mind doesn't require you
to own a vehicle you don't want. It means looking for the features you want
with the best available fuel economy. Learn more about how to buy a fuel-efficient
car.
 

How Torque Converters Work - In a car with an automatic transmission, an amazing device
called a torque converter lets the engine turn while the wheels and gears in
the transmission come to a stop. Learn how a torque converter works and why
it's needed.
   
This Week's Video
 

Review of 2008 Dodge Viper - After a 2007 model-year hiatus, a more powerful Dodge Viper
arrives as an early 2008 model. This high-performance two-seat sports car comes
as a coupe or convertible, in a new array of colors, including Venom Red and
Snakeskin Green. Find out more in this HowStuffWorks video.
